verb.description: Hold, bend, or distort (a part of the body, especially of an animal) so as to form an angle or angles.
examples: the hindquarters are more strongly angulated than the forequarters

origin: Late 15th century (as angulated, used chiefly as a botanical or zoological term): from Latin angulatus, past participle of angulare, from angulus angle. The skiing term dates from the 1970s.
